channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [BOOKKEEPER-250] Need a ledger manager like interface to manage metadata operations in Hedwig
item.description: it would be better to a ledger-manager like interface to manage metadata operations in Hedwig, which might be easy for use to adapt to meta store api.
item.summary: Need a ledger manager like interface to manage metadata operations in Hedwig

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: add a patch to provide a MetadataManager interface to manage metadata used in Hedwig.

Review request for bookkeeper.

Summary
-------

it would be better to a ledger-manager like interface to manage metadata operations in Hedwig, which might be easy for use to adapt to meta store api.

This addresses bug BOOKKEEPER-250.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BOOKKEEPER-250

attach a new patch rebased on latest trunk.
new patch similar as BOOKKEEPER-203, to remove zookeeper integer version dependency.

Changes look very good. I have a few minor comments.

  • ManagerLayout should use protobufs
  • I think the "Persistence" methods on MetadataManager would be better as "TopicPersistence" methods. i.e. writePersistenceInfo -> writeTopicPersistenceInfo
  • In writePersistenceInfo, i don't like how a special meaning is assigned to operationFinished with null. It'd be better to call operationFailed, with a custom error code for Conflicted version.

Actually, having looked at BOOKKEEPER-259, I think it would be better to split MetadataManager into TopicPersistenceManager and SubscriptionDataManager, and then for BOOKKEEPER-259 add TopicOwnerManager.

Also, im not sure how this is all configured from hw_server.conf. Perhaps we don't want to provide complete pluggability at the Manager layer, as we'll be providing pluggability at the metastore layer anyhow.

Actually, looking more into 259, i see that topicOwner ops are in MetadataManager now also. This is fine. But I don't understand why TopicManager has now become an implementer of the manager interface?

ManagerLayout should use protobufs

good point. would improve it in new patch.

But I don't understand why TopicManager has now become an implementer of the manager interface?

MMTopicManager is using version write for ledger election, so it writes the owner info as persist znode in ZooKeeper, which is different from ZKTopicManager. I tried to leverage ManagerLayout to record manager class and version, and initiate the topic manager according to manager layout info recorded in zookeeper to load right manager.

attach a new patch rebased on latest trunk and address Ivan's comments.

1) ManagerLayout should use protobufs
2) split MetadataManager into TopicPersistenceManager and SubscriptionDataManager
3) adding a custom error code for Conflicted version.

review board: https://reviews.apache.org/r/5101/diff/3/

attach a new patch to rebase on latest trunk, after BOOKKEEPER-203 is in.

review board: https://reviews.apache.org/r/5101/diff/4

attach a new patch addressing Ivan's comments.

review board: https://reviews.apache.org/r/5101/diff/5/
Very close to being ready to submission. I just have 3 small comments on RB

attach a new patch to address Ivan's reviews.

review board: https://reviews.apache.org/r/5101/diff/5-6/#index_header

I had a cursory at this patch, it is great work. I have only a couple of high level comments that shouldn't hold this patch, but would be good to keep in mind:

  1. It would be nice to have some documentation about it. I understand that this is internal, but it would help anyone interested in having a different meta store.
  2. Adding some more detail to javadocs would help to navigate through the code.

It is +1 for me.
@Flavio. yup. we need documentations for both ledger manager and hedwig metadata manager so other one know how to provide different implementation.

Integrated in bookkeeper-trunk #601 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/bookkeeper-trunk/601/)
